Detailed Description

template<int dimworld>
class Dune::GridFactory< FoamGrid< dimworld > >

Specialization of the generic GridFactory for FoamGrid.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<int dimworld>
Dune::GridFactory< FoamGrid< dimworld > >::GridFactory (  )  [inline]

Default constructor.

template<int dimworld>
Dune::GridFactory< FoamGrid< dimworld > >::GridFactory ( FoamGrid< dimworld > *  grid  )  [inline]

Constructor for a given grid object.

If you already have your grid object constructed you can hand it over using this constructor.

If you construct your factory class using this constructor the pointer handed over to you by the method createGrid() is the one you supplied here.

template<int dimworld>
virtual Dune::GridFactory< FoamGrid< dimworld > >::~GridFactory (  )  [inline, virtual]

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

template<int dimworld>
virtual FoamGrid<dimworld>* Dune::GridFactory< FoamGrid< dimworld > >::createGrid (  )  [inline, virtual]

Finalize grid creation and hand over the grid.

The receiver takes responsibility of the memory allocated for the grid

References Dune::FoamGridEntityImp< 2, dimworld >::edges_, Dune::FoamGridEntityImp< 1, dimworld >::elements_, and Dune::FoamGridEntityImp< 2, dimworld >::vertex_.

template<int dimworld>
virtual void Dune::GridFactory< FoamGrid< dimworld > >::insertBoundarySegment ( const std::vector< unsigned int > &  vertices,
const shared_ptr< BoundarySegment< 2 > >  boundarySegment 
) [inline, virtual]

Insert a boundary segment (== a line) and the boundary segment geometry.

This influences the ordering of the boundary segments. Currently, the BoundarySegment object does not actually have any effect.

template<int dimworld>
virtual void Dune::GridFactory< FoamGrid< dimworld > >::insertBoundarySegment ( const std::vector< unsigned int > &  vertices  )  [inline, virtual]

Insert a boundary segment.

This is only needed if you want to control the numbering of the boundary segments
